autoTutorScript.script: <name> Hi. I'm happy you are joining us for this lesson! My name is Cristina and I will be your tutor throughout this program.
<name>, hello! I'm Jordan! I will be here learning with you! I'm happy you are here to learn with me.
In this lesson we will show you how to identify print and visual cues, titles and subtitles. Also, how to make predictions using these signals.
Cristina, Can you explain what these text signals are?

Yes. Take a look at this book. You can see the title of the book, Ending Back Pain; in green. the visual cue of a person suffering from back pain is in yellow. and the subtitle of the book is in blue.
I got it. So the title gives us general information, the visual cue is related to the topic of the book, and the subtitle shows us more information about the topic. Can we get started?
Yes, lets start. But first, I should tell you that as we go along in the lessons, you may notice that two buttons appear at the bottom left of your screen.

These are a repeat button and a video button. You can press the repeat button if you need to hear something again. You can press the video button if you would like to review the video that highlights the lessons main points.
Now, I think we are ready. For this activity you will need to select the print cues or visual cues that complete the book cover or street sign.

From there you will have to make predictions about the material. Let's look over the current book cover and take note of the different text signals. When you are ready, please click on the continue button to start the activity.

questions.prompt: Click the title on the book cover.
Click on the book's visual cue.
Click the title on the book cover.
Click the subtitle on the book.
Click the title on the book cover.
Click the title on the book's visual cue
Click on the book's visual cue.
Predict what the sign is telling you.

answers.answer: Only park here for loading and unloading
Handicap parking, park where you'd like
Handicap parking only you will be fined $100-$500

questions.prompt: Predict what the sign is telling you.

answers.answer: You have a right not to wear your seat belt.
You are required to wear your seat belt.
You are not safe wearing you seat belt.

questions.correctAnswer: You have a right not to wear your seat belt.

questions.prompt: Click on the book title that matches the other cues on the book cover.
Predict the message of the book.

answers.answer: A couple dealing with each other's past and loving each other
Finding nature and looking for love

questions.correctAnswer: A couple dealing with each other's past and loving each other

questions.prompt: Which Prediction is the best for what might happen in the book?

answers.answer: The couple will go through hardships and their love will be tested
The book will serve as a guide for surviving the wild
The book shows a couple enduring parenthood and their love life

questions.correctAnswer: The couple will go through hardships and their love will be tested

questions.prompt: Click on the book title that matches the other cues on the book cover.
Predict the message of the book.

answers.answer: A look into Lincoln's presidency from the viewpoint of his close friends
A history lesson about George Washington
A review of the children of American presidents

questions.correctAnswer: A look into Lincoln's presidency from the viewpoint of his close friends

questions.prompt: What is an appropriate title for this sign?
Which text cue would be appropriate for the sign?
Predict what the sign is trying to tell us.

answers.answer: Use caution when driving near railroad crossing
Yield to other drivers on the road
You must stop at this location on the red light

questions.correctAnswer: Use caution when driving near railroad crossing

questions.prompt: Predict where this sign will most likely be seen.
Does the title of the book match the visual cues on the book cover?

answers.answer: The title does match the other cues on the book cover.
The title does NOT match the other cues on the book cover.
The title does not match the subtitle but does match the visual cue.

questions.correctAnswer: The title does match the other cues on the book cover.

questions.prompt: Predict what the book is about based on the text signals on the book's cover.

answers.answer: It teaches students how to bake pies
It describes how to juice with fruits and prevent disease by juicing
It helps people learn how to cook with whole foods

questions.correctAnswer: It teaches students how to bake pies

questions.prompt: Does the visual cue match the text signals on the cover?

answers.answer: The visual cue does not match the subtitle
The visual cue does not match the title
The visual cue matches the title and subtitle

questions.correctAnswer: The visual cue does not match the subtitle

questions.prompt: Predict what the book is about.

answers.answer: The creation of airplanes in America
A story about fighter planes and pilots in World War II.
The history of sailors in the U.S. Navy.

questions.correctAnswer: The creation of airplanes in America

questions.prompt: Does the title match the visual cues on the book?

answers.answer: The title doesn't support the visual cues.
The title supports only part of the visual cues.
The title supports the visual cues shown.

questions.correctAnswer: The title doesn't support the visual cues.

questions.prompt: Predict the title based on the visual cue.

answers.answer: Aunt Dimity and the Wishing Well

questions.prompt: Does the subtitle match the text signals present?

answers.answer: The subtitle does not support the text signals
The subtitle supports the visual cues but not the title

questions.prompt: Click on the visual cue that matches the other cues on the book cover.
Predict what the book is about based on the text signals on the cover.

answers.answer: A dragon pretends to be a goat to get into a palace.
A dragon slayer must save a princess.
There is a king that leaves his throne for the love of his life.

questions.correctAnswer: A dragon pretends to be a goat to get into a palace.

autoTutorScript.script: How did you think you did?
I don't think I did so well. I want to try again.
I think you are ready for the next lesson! Thank you for learning with us.
